alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Jackson (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 1:23PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Jackson and central DeKalb Counties through 200 PM CDT... At 123 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sylvania, or 8 miles north of Rainsville, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Scottsboro, Rainsville, Henagar, Sylvania, Powell, Pisgah, and Dutton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Lake Guntersville, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
